memories.author: Jane Barfoot Hodde
memories.source: "125 Years: Olga: Memories and Potlucks" (Compiled by Irene Barfoot O'Neill)
memories.content: "In 1893, the closest post office to Olga was at Doe Bay. Application was made for establishment of a Post Office at Olga. The first-choice name was Rosario but, since that was already in use, another name had to be chosen. Anthony Ohlert was one of the town's leading citizens, as well as store keeper. He suggested his mother's name, Olga, and it was accepted."
